Reviews.Title: “Good views but tired decor and a really bad smell!”
Reviews.Author: retsie
Reviews.Content: We were greeted to a bad odour when we first entered the room that didnt go away. The room itself was more a 2 star level. The only good thing was the view- views were outstanding of Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, great location.”
Reviews.Author: saussi67
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel traversed the steep staircase with luggage. Was greeted by a lovely friendly gentlemen. Arrived at 6th floor studio/loft room. Clean, tidy, great views. The bed was comfortable, the shower hot, clean sheets, clean towels. Easy short walk to Darling Harbour and King St Wharf restaurants. Was a little noisy with the Chinese Laundry nightclub, kicking off at midnight and the ensuing crowds leaving and arriving at the venue. But our stay was enjoyable. Not five star but we didnt pay for five star. Not usually in the habit of sitting in bed and watching television but like to do so when staying in a hotel/Motel, however, the television was on the lower level, a television in the loft would have been an advantage. With a little bit of sprucing up the place would be wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location makes up for the tired decor”
Reviews.Author: Rachel378
Reviews.Content: We booked an eight night stay at these apartments. After having read the reviews we opened the door with trepidation. Granted the apartment we were allocated needed a coat of paint & the kitchen & bathroom need brought up to date. That said the apartment was spotlessly clean, the carpet looked relatively new & the bed was really comfortable. There was constant road traffic noise however we were always too tired to notice it & up early in the morning's to allow it to disturb our stay. The front desk staff were excellent & always pleasant & helpful. For the price we paid we were delighted overall with the apartment given that we paid significantly less for it than other options we looked at in the Darling Harbour area. You have to weigh up the amount of time you actually spend in your accommodation & we literally only slept there which made it a great deal. Excellent location within easy walking distance of all the key Sydney attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother if family”
Reviews.Author: Darren V
Reviews.Content: Before arriving at our accommodation I contacted Metro Apartments to see if they had single level rooms due to having a 3 year old and an 8 month old. The person found our booking and advised us that we did have a single level room only to find on arrival the entire hotel was mezzanine type rooms. Very dangerous for 3 year olds with open balcony which caused us to have her sleep between us every night (not very relaxing). Only stairs for access into the hotel and we witnessed a number of families having to carry strollers and kids up the stairs including ourselves with two strollers. We too were given level one directly above the intersection and unless you are out partying Friday ans Saturday nights are a nightmare for getting any sleep. Then the traffic starts early for the workers during the week. Fire Trucks frequently travelling across the bridge and down past the hotel with sirens going, we were averaging two a day. Bed was that old we could feel every wire in it. Luckily for us that by day 3 a new bed was delivered and we at least had a comfortable bed to listen to the party city every night. Kitchen was dated and a number of our items were missing compared to family in another room. Dirty wash cloth found in bathroom from previous tennants and some soaps not refilled. Housekeeping was hit and miss with towels and fac cloths being replaced. Location is awesome for Darling Harbour and for the price it was good if you don't have kids.

Reviews.Title: “No problems. Just not salubrious.”
Reviews.Author: peekay68
Reviews.Content: Sydney is all about location, location, location - and harbour views. On that basis, the Metro On Darling gets a high rating. Corner of Sussex and King, right across the road from the Slip Inn (where Mary met Frederick, in case you know your Australian-Danish royalty), and with fantastic views over Darling Harbour towards the Pyrmont side. Also, walking distance from Cockle Bay, Kings Street Wharf, Pitt and George Streets - even The Rocks was only a 20min walk away. So with such prime location, you'd think they could throw some cash at the place and make it a little less shabby. It's not that it's really bad - just dated. The wi-fi (free, depending on how you bought your stay) requires little password slips which you need to get from Reception, and which then only work sometimes - which is annoying - and everything else just feels like it needs a lick of paint. BUT - it's a killer price for what it is, the service (including airport transfer service) is OK, and Sydney is not a place to visit if you want to stay indoors. So for the few hours per day you'll spend here, plus the great advantage of being able to do your own washing and cook some breakfasts before you head out, it's a great option for travellers who want a gorgeous view without having to hack off a limb and offer it to the money gods. Just don't set your expectations too high. If they DO renovate it, they'll probably charge twice the price (and get it). Then you'll be sorry... A final note: Pyrmont, a short 15-minute walk across Darling Harbour over the Pyrmont foot bridge, has had a major renaissance over the past couple of years and is now a FANTASTIC place to seek out dinner and drinks. A whole precinct of bars and restaurants has sprung up there, with some outstanding food much cheaper than Darling Harbour. Try Wok Station on Harris Street. An absolute find.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: snjjben
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel upon returning from a cruise. We needed one night before flying home. We arrived early back into Sydney (before 10am) and upon our arrival at the apartment were immediately welcomed. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. We had heaps of luggage and walking up the front stairs didn't make me happy - no ramp. That was the only negative. The room was clean and tidy, the beds were comfortable. It was close to Darling Harbour which had plenty of things for the kids to do and see. Would stay here again and the price was great.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, noisy, dingy & overpriced”
Reviews.Author: dreamsaremadeofthis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here January 2012 with 3 kids, on 5th floor overlooking the intersection of Sussex & King Streets. Having paid more than I really wanted to , I expected at least a decent standard of accomadation. However the lift was quite frightening, the corridor to our room was claustrophobic & stunk & then we entered the room........a small, crowded ,dingy mess. Everything was old, dirty,chipped & broken. Very unappealing. Beds were uncomfortable & the noise from the street was loud & continued ALL night. Room had tall windows which were impossible to cover completely with the vertical blinds, so felt that others across street could always see into room. Carpet was shabby & bathroom old & in need of a good clean ( or preferably a total overhaul). Would NOT recomend to anyone. I have stayed in better & certainly much cheaper hostels. An absolute disgrace. They should be ashamed to charge that much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but get a room on a high floor”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Patten
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with my stay at these apartments, mainly because I had a room on a high floor. During my stay there were roadworks directly outside which were INCREDIBLY noisy, and I dread to think what guests in lower floor rooms were going through. This can hardly be blamed on the hotel of course, but it does illustrate that a fair amount of noise from outside can be heard. There is a pub directly across the road which gets busy, but can't say I was disturbed too much by this. There are a few steep steps to enter the premises, but this did not unduly worry me personally. Could be a bit awkward for others though No complaints about the room at all. Very clean and tidy, and well appointed. I especially liked the open-plan feel of the place, with the view out across Darling Harbour. No complaints about the service either. The little dealings I had with staff were always efficient and drama-free. The location is perfect, Darling Harbour is pretty much right outside your door. Overall, had a pleasant stay, but definitely try to get a room as high as you can.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, not good for older people”
Reviews.Author: Jenna P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother and my grandmother. It was a great room however the stairs were too much for my grandmother. Even for me at times in the middle of the night when I was sleepy and had to treck up about 20 steps. A bit far from the bridge but you can catch a ferry.It is a great location for shopping trips as George St is only a stone throw away. Clean room, helpful staff. The only things that i was not happy with was the balcony not being paved and got very muddy in the rain and the enormous sounds of traffic passing by at all hours of the day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy run down apartments”
Reviews.Author: MiniMooToo
Reviews.Content: Spend the extra 20-30 dollars and stay somewhere that takes more care and consideration. A horrible stay. Double glazed windows? The noise would suggest otherwise. I was traveling on my own on this occasion and did not feel safe in these apartments. I am glad it was for just one night. Could do with a really good clean and the official photos make it appear much much nicer then it is. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Findleycat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metro with hubby and 7 year old in October holidays 2011. Stayed on the 4th floor and exceptional views across darling harbour. The best thing about these apartments is the location to transport. Straight across the road to kings wharf for ferry trips, 5 min walk to monorail, which takes you to paddy's markets, light rail connections, and the city. short walk to all the attractions at darling harbour. Love the loft set up so you can wake up to the views. negatives: are the steep front step to drag your cases up - especially since its an apartment & we had a couple of extra bags of food for our stay (I dont think elderly people would like it). especially since you are already taking it from the parking station down the road. The matress could have done with an update - bit saggy and the noise from the the streets. The car noises are constant and double glazing would alleviate this, (The staff says this is on the agenda for next year ). there was a drunken fight right outside at 4am one morning but i think you cant really blame the hotel for this. its proximity to a couple of popular nightclubs results in this. generally though for an apartment this close to all the attractions & the great view, I think it is worth the price they charge. We had a great stay - and whilst the room could have been maintained a bit better (cracks in the bathroom) it was clean and functional. If you want to stay in the city and in the middle of all the excitement - even if this means a bit of noise - i think its worth it - if you want a quieter night in the city you would have to double the tarrif or not have the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Want a quiet stay? Forget it!!”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: Being on a budget, chose Metro as have stayed in other Metros in and around Sydney with fair results. However this one is the exception. On the Saturday night [for which the tariff was not cheap] managed 2hours sleep due to the feral behaviour out on the street from midnight to after 5am and the room offered no protection from the dreadful racket plus the traffic noise on the other nights made me feel I was on a freeway. Sure it is close to everything especially 6 nightclubs and about 100 cars per minute from 5.30am to 1.00am. My suggestion is to turn it into a nightclub and forget running it as apartments!

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Ozbraids
Reviews.Content: The hotel is rundown and extreamley over priced. To get to reception you must get up a large flight of stairs and lug you bags up them NO ramp or help. The location is at the entrance to the cafe strip but the noise of late night revelers and police sirens come right into the room all night. Could see out of the window hadn't been cleaned in ages, vetical blinds miss some of the strips.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but what about the mystery noise?”
Reviews.Author: coastalsmiles
Reviews.Content: These apartments were great for what we needed, close to everything and a great outlook over to the Aquarium and Darling Harbour. Being on the edge of the City they did have street noise which you get in most City places I think. We stayed in Room 604 but with that room came a 'mystery' noise in the wall (probably in the pipes) that we named 'Henry'. Henry only appeared on our 3rd night but thankfully I had ear plugs but my friends didn't so they were not as well rested. The management were great and did have people looking at it and offered to move us which we couldn't be bothered as were only there for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jenster70
Reviews.Content: We saw the pictures of this hotel on the internet and thought this would be a good place to stay for New Years. When we actually got our room it was clear that the pictures on the internet site were of a room that had been fixed up. Sadly, that was definitely NOT our room. The carpets were grungy, the kitchen appliances were dated (the only new appliance was a dryer upstairs), the shades were broken (though to be fair someone did come up to fix them up somewhat), there was black moldy looking marks all around where the old air conditioning unit had been (they hadn't even bothered to paint to cover the old a/c's outline), and the shower was also moldy and the wall/tile part of the bath tub/shower was black and definitely crumbling. The place smelt very moldy as well - so bad that we went next door to the convenience store to buy some air freshener! I went down to the front desk after seeing the room to ask if other rooms looked similar (in hopes of changing room) but the guy replied that pretty much all the rooms were the same, and the bathrooms were the next thing on their refurbishment list! Because of the time of year and having paid in advance, we pretty much were stuck there. All I could think of the whole time we were there was how much toxic mold we were inhaling. On New Years Eve day no one came and cleaned our room either. The ONLY positive thing about this place was the location. It's right across the street from the Aquarium and we could see the Darling Harbour fireworks from our very small old balcony. But, that would not make me want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families (but not too young!)”
Reviews.Author: olthomas44
Reviews.Content: How hard is it to find affordable family accommodation in Sydney? Very! We booked the metro apartments on King street which is just opposite but on arrival were 'upgraded' to this one. It was perfect for us. While a little on the tired side it provided all we needed including kitchenette and laundry facilities. The split level mezzanine is NOT suitable if u have younger children. DH metro doesn't have a pool but as we had originally booked for King St they let us have access to the roof pool over there. Location wise it is prefect for Darling Harbour and the circular quay ferry. They also included details of how to get take pit food couriered to the room. One evening when we had very tired kids we gave it a try and got gorgeous Wagamama's food delivered in 20 mins. As new customers we got a bonus discount so it cost us less than walking and collecting ourselves. I'd have no qualms about booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but doesn't offer much more than that!”
Reviews.Author: soxli
Reviews.Content: An old and very average aparatment situated in an excellent location, close to city and Darling Harbour. No parking available on site, parking is about 200 metres away, no lifts or ramps with about 14 stairs to carry up heavy suitcases. Staff barely acknowledged us during our 4 day stay. Decor is cheap and nasty and balcony looks like its about to collapse. Quite small and pokey. Rooms were clean. We travel to Sydney regularly for business and there are far better rooms available for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “room wasnt as good as pictured”
Reviews.Author: letsgoholiday
Reviews.Content: Staff were nice, location was very central. But the rooms looked so nice in the photo's (we booked via the internet) When we got there the room was quite scabby, old & broken. There were doors in the kitchen that had broken hinges, the shower tap actually fell off when i used it & the shower area was all rusty the carpets were well worn & old.. no it wasnt cheap either.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location outweighs the cheap furnishings”
Reviews.Author: qwertyWiganUK
Reviews.Content: The main reason to stay here really is the location, overlooking the aquarium and darling harbour. The accomodation is spacious and on two levels, with the bedroom and bathroom on a mezzanine, bathroom has a washer dryer. As stated in the other reviews, the apartments are dated and cheaply furnished but the pros outweighed the cons for us and we liked the split level.Staff not particularly friendly. one of the daytime receptionists looked down or at his computer as we passed a couple of times, didnt bother us though but it could some. All in all good value in the best location.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could find much better hotels”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Melb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in major need of refurbishment. The room we had holes in plaster work in bathroom and very old 80s kitchen (the fridge wasn't on on arrival) and was generally just very tired. Not sure if some rooms have been refurbished. Floor to ceiling windows over both levels had vertical blinds which did little to block out sunlight and we were on the third floor above a pub which was having an outside party and was extremely loud in our room. Balcony was only a foot wide and covered in tan bark? Was schoolies weekend I think, so not sure if this is normal practice but we were all made to sign something telling us we couldn't have visitors in the room post 10pm without signing them in and paying a $40 charge. Bit insulting given we were all in our 30s. Parking is also 100 metres down the road which is a bit inconvenient with lots of luggage. Only stayed here cos busy weekend in Sydney and couldn't find other options. Would find something better next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Great value, but rooms well due for an update”
Reviews.Author: mudsweatngears
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing view over darling harbour, which is only a short walk away. The centre of the City is alo only a few block away as well, so A++++++ location. It was one of the cheaper options for us, so A- for value. The rooms were obviously built in the early eighties, and the cook top, oven, washing machine and dryer are all original in their mission brown greatness, its had new carpet , paint and a basic freshen up.......but it is all a BIT tired! ***Not suitable for families with toddlers or crawlers or climbers**** as the upper bedroom is suspended above the lounge with only a steel handrail, which kids could easily fall through or climb over..... and its a long drop!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for tourists with great views over Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: debsopinion
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location on Sussex Street right next to King Street Wharf and Darling Harbour perfect if you're on holidays in Sydney and want to be close to attractions and amenities. Walking distance to a major supermarket as well as the main shopping area of the CBD. The rooms are clean & comfortable though the furniture and carpet could use some updating. The front office staff and housekeeping staff were positively lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Will try somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: Barnie77
Reviews.Content: Same problem as other reviews, stayed in apartments on King street with different name, not sure whether it had really new furniture and the fresh paint didn't improve the fittings that needing fixing like the kitchen shutters, bathroom ceiling, shower screen and bedroom door. Extremely noisy with traffic 24/7, bed not comfortable at all and intercom to room didn't work when having dinner delivered. Room was very hot and air conditioner only cooled bedroom and noise from street made it impossible to have doors and windows open. Would not allow children in pool as very run down. Only bonus was the location with it being in walking distance to all the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “very nice, great location, good for family, friendly people”
Reviews.Author: luvthesunGreenBay_WI
Reviews.Content: nice and clean room, great view of the harbor, easy to find, walking distance to opera house, the rocks district, harbour bridge, bus station, diners, water taxi tours - on the edge of china town, laundry in room, coffee, hair dryer, plenty of space for 4 maybe 6 if you don't mind floor space, nice kitchen, staff was friendly as we needed to store our luggage after we checked out and that was not a problem. shopping across the harbor nice big mall - not to spendy we only had a day and a half in sydney - could have had 2 more days - not much more then that - cool time of the year there, wear pants and sweater - comfy cloths are best we did not tour the opera house, we did harbour tour, Captain cook tours nice staff there remember to bring tylonol PM to get some rest - the time change is hard to get used to!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mmommof3
Reviews.Content: I must admit my first impression of the place was that the reception staff needed to seem a bit more welcoming. But having said that, the staff was really helpful and attended to whatever issues we had. You can't beat the location and the price. Unlike a lot of serviced apartments that we've stayed in, the apartment is cleaned daily. There was a laundry in our apartment but the dryer wasn't working properly -something actually started buring and the apartment was soon filled with smoke- a concern for me with 2 small children. I was pretty peeved that we weren't offered any other option while we waited for the smoke to air out. We did get a small discount because of that and they were apologetic and quick to come to our apt, and helpful in sorting out my laundry needs. In a nutshell, this is value for money, in a great location, with everything u could possibly want in the apartment. If it weren't for the dryer incident, which hopefully would make them check the condition of their washers and dryers from now on, I'd say our stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to return”
Reviews.Author: truro47
Reviews.Content: We are relatively frequent travelers to Australia (family visits as well as general touring). Discovered Metro Apartments several years ago and have now stayed there three times (full month each time), They are beautifully situated a short walk from Darling Harbour and its' attractions. Also very close to George Street and a modest walk from Circular Quay and The Rocks. The hotel staff is very friendly and attentive to our needs. Room maintenance is very good and price, for this location, is excellent. Just be aware that the rooms have a full height sleeping bedroom/loft. No problem for us (actually, the full height glass window gives one a nice view of Darling Harbour from both levels) but some might prefer a single level layout. We like this place very much and will return in 2011 (our next scheduled trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMayWallis
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to Darling Harbour, panaromic views from the floor to ceiling widows even from the bed, extremely confortable, friendly staff, Cafe very cosy with friendly staff and a great breakfast. as we said loved it, we be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night for the price”
Reviews.Author: 4AussiesSydney
Reviews.Content: Booked this on wotif and actually stayed in the Apartment across the road that is listed as Metro on King, but you have to go here to get your keys anyway. Tapping the "auto"entry for the front door took 10 minutes but once in the place was clean. Sliding doors in bedroom didn't close properly and shower door completely jammed. Broken tiles and worn fixtures in kitchen and bathroom. Not too noisy, could hear some internal and external noise, but not too bad. Really good location though close to city and Darling Harbour, so probably couldn't ask for much more for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: NewTravellersTas
Reviews.Content: Booked into Metro on King and ended up sent across the road to the Kingsley. 1st room too noisy, disgusting carpets and furniture. Ceiling in bathroom falling down. Complained and was advised by staff that we were moving to the Manager's "favourite room in the hotel". Ha Ha Room 901 was quieter but equally dirty. Rotting wood step in bathroom - didn't bother showering as would have come out dirtier than went in! False advertising - no mention on wotif of a 2nd location, we paid for one hotel and got another one. Ad says newly refurbished I would hate to have seen it before! Foxtel included - Not! Could only receive 2 channels of free to air tv. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I wouldn't send my dog here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: invictusinanimo
Reviews.Content: What a great location Just cross at the lights out the front of the apartments and across a foot bridge to the aquarium at Darling Harbour. Receptionist was extremely friendly and helpful - even our arrival with young son in urgent need of a bathroom was met with genuine warmth. The room we had was tired but well appointed for an extended stay. I would not recommend to family with toddler as the banisters on stairs and mezzanine level not suitable. Unfortunately the bed in our room was hammock like, so the sofa bed in the lounge room provided a more comfortable sleeping option. For a great location with all you require for a comfortable stay( perhaps ask about room with more comfortable bed) it was a great no fuss base to explore Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in lower levels - too noisy”
Reviews.Author: LucWA
Reviews.Content: We were initially booked into level 2 right by the traffic intersection. Could not sleep a wink due to noise . Were move to level 4 and was just tolerable. Windows do not keep out noise like other hotels. Carpet grubby and doors missing from cupboards in kitchen. Only thing going for it is closeness to Darling Harbour and CBD.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic view & perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sammymay
Reviews.Content: My husband & I enjoyed a 2 night stay on th 6th floor in Sussex Street venue. Wonderful view & facilities. Comfortable bed & air conditioning. Walking distance to Pitt Street Mall, Darling Harbour & Chinatown or catch the Monorail. We chose to purchase a day pass and board at the Harbourside stop - located on the other side of Darling Harbour upstairs near the Shopping complex - so the Monorail can be accessed from a number of points. Grab a brochure from reception. We took a ferry ride from Darling Harbour around to Circular Quay to see the Harbour Bridge & Opera House. We had a bit of a stressful time driving in the city at the beginning and locating the car park which we realised was a "Kings Park" accessed from 383 Sussex St not a parking facility in King St . But once that was resolved we got stuck into the sightseeing. We would recommend the Sky Tower for an evening meal in the revolving restaurant within walking distance in Market St. Though pricey we splurged and the view was magnificent. Go before sunset to see the sights in daylight then enjoy the night lights of Sydney. If driving a GPS is a must!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but goodie...”
Reviews.Author: fc71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Metro for 2 weeks while doing a course in Sydney city. it is very old and susequently looks quite grotty (carpets, laundry etc) but it was actually very clean. I was on the 6th floor and had no problems sleeping (luckily i am an early riser as the jackhammers started around 7am, they are building a cycle path downstairs). Walking distance to trains, malls and ferries, views over Darling Harbour, helpful staff and the best water pressure i have ever encountered in a Sydney hotel. I was in a one bedroom loft which was very spacious. The washing machine and dryer are old and noisy (easily combatted by shutting the bathroom door). I have previously stayed in hotels in this area for the same price which were of a similar vintage with 1/3 of the floor space and no kitchen or laundry. Booking through wotif, cheaperthanhotels etc gives a more reasonable rate than Metros website. Value for money is unbeatable at <$200 night, yes, it needs a facelift but once it gets one I would expect rack rate to increase significantly.

Reviews.Title: “Grubby and Noisy - Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: Travelscan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Metro Appartments for 4 nights Sept 2008. This establishment is spread over two buildings, the main building with Reception on the corner of King and Sussex, and a second building across the road in King St. We were checked into an appartment in the King St building on the 1st floor. I think this must be the noisiest hotel room we have ever stayed in- and we have stayed in many.The double glazed windows made no difference, the roar of the traffic made sleep impossible. The bed was lumpy with springs poking thru. The TV antenna wall socket was broken so TV reception was hit and miss.The shower door fell off its tracks at the slightest touch. The laminate on the cupboards was peeling and the bath tub was stained black. The furniture was grubby and the carpet stained. At least the linen was clean. Next morning I complained to the staff and was given another room in the main building. This was an improvement but still looked very tired. Being on the 4th floor, traffic noise was less and sleep was just possible. The bathroom was in better shape but the kitchen had peeling laminate and broken cupboard door hinges. Furniture was grubby, carpet stained. Cigarette burns on bench tops and carpet - in a no smoking room? All up this place is a dump badly in need of a total make-over, which is a pity because the location is great, being between Darling Harbour and the CBD. The staff try their best and are helpfull but are let down by the run down facilities. Not 3 star as claimed.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy!”
Reviews.Author: lelasuzi
Reviews.Content: Myself and my cousin stayed for 4 nights in May. On arrival we had to carry our heavy cases up the steps to reception. We both have mobility problems. There where many people waiting to cross the street and 1 lady helped us to carry our luggage. We thanked her and she said we are all people. I hope she wins the Lottery. Check-in was fine. We got to the room and my cousin cried. It was filthy! Everything was sticky including the carpet. It was disgusting. We went to the convenience store next door and bought cleaning stuff. The bathroom was ok but a bit dated except for the washer and dryer which looked brand new. The kitchen was disgusting. The cooker was all rusted and sticky with grease. I have stayed here before but it was`nt like this. We hated it. I asked reception if we could have 2 extra hours on departure day but they said sorry we are fully booked. When I said we had had to clean the apt they agreed to our extra time - no charge. Yes, its in a fantastic location, we did`nt mind the traffic noise, we did`nt care about all the rowdy drunks on Fri/Sat night but we would never stay there again. I`m sorry for the staff as I`m sure its not their fault.

Reviews.Title: “A well located dump”
Reviews.Author: B.Pongratz
Reviews.Content: Metro Apartments offers one bedroom apartments in two buildings, opposite each other. We spent three nights in the King Street property. I had read reviews about excessive noise and requested a high floor. Unfortunately that meant catching the lift to the 8th floor, then dragging our child and pram up two flights of stairs to the 9th floor! Apartment 901 was pokey, with cheap chipboard furniture and a very grimey bathroom. The shower is over the bath and there's a mouldy wooden step into the bath. The bathroom looked as though it was regularly cleaned but, because of it's age, the grout was dirty and the fittings very worn. The biggest disappointment was appalling water-pressure - I gave up trying to wash my hair in a trickle from the shower. The queen size bed was comfortable and very clean sheets. Our 4 year old slept on the fold out couch in the tiny lounge room, which left nowhere to sit and watch tv when he was asleep. I tried to move the tv into the bedroom (separated by a sliding door) but the only powerpoint looked like a burnt-out death-trap so I gave up. The tv reception disappeared at 9pm anyway, and then took a day for it to be restored. On the plus side, the room was quiet and is only minutes walk to the city. It also offered a beautiful view of the sun setting behind Darling Harbour. We won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: MattandTaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and couldn't wait to leave. The room is very outdated and the windows were really dirty! There was no point in having a balcony because there were rocks everywhere and cigarette butts from the previous occupants. We really felt dirty in this room, because it just felt dirty in general!!! The traffic noise is really bad and for us we found it hard to sleep even though the bed was upstairs (we stayed in a loft). The bathroom was also in need of a revamp as it looked dated from the 70's/80's. We also did not like the service. Instead of being able to walk straight into the foyer/reception area (which is really tiny and dark) you have to be buzzed in. Highly inconvenient when you have just lugged luggage up the stairs!! Upon request of an additional 20minutes after checkout time, we were told rudely it would be an extra $35 so we didn't bother! I would not recommend this room to anyone because the room is dirty and the service is not that great either. I feel this place could be something worth staying in if it were revamped and if sound-proofed cathedral windows are installed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the apartment - great location. Very clean, everything was provided”
Reviews.Author: Mariamarple
Reviews.Content: Loved this apartment. Simple but spacious with great views of Darling Harbour with ferries 2 minutes walk away. The large washing maching and tumble dryer was a real boon. Staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. I stayed from Monday to Thursday and it was very quiet. As a single traveller it was convenient and safe. Will definitely return as soon as I can save up enough to return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: DisgruntledMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The Metro Apartments are centrally located, close to Darling Harbour if you are on holiday. The apartments are in need of refurbishment, stained carpets and tired furniture. Very basic but cheap. The main problem is the noise - it is absolutely dreadful. There is constant traffic noise and also noise from restaurants / clubs close by - screaming, loud music, hooting from cars etc. This stops at about 3am.

Reviews.Title: “good location but tired”
Reviews.Author: jooles29
Reviews.Content: Agree that location excellent and did not find it particularly noisy but disappointed with the apartment itself. The mezzine and bathroom were fine but downstairs very tired. The kitchen worktops left a little to be desired but kitchen was adequate. The worst feature was the sofa. It was old and the cushions collapsed when sat on. The mattress on the bed was the thinnest I have ever seen. It was impossible for two teenagers to sleep on. When requested the staff provided a camp bed which was of no better quality, it was more like a hammock!! The chilgren did manage to sleep though. Feel paying for the location and not the quality of accomodation. Would not go back

Reviews.Title: “Great View over Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: 8788joanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 days in October and had a great time. We were on the 10th floor overlooking Darling Harbour and wow! what a view. The facilities in the room were excellant although it could do with a lick of paint. The kids slept on the sofa bed and we enjoyed the view from the mezzanine bedroom especially at night. We would agree with previous posts about the noise levels but this was only an issue on Friday and Saturday, other nights it wasn't so bad and it didn't stop us getting plenty of sleep. We would definately re-book.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: grahamk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, a two minute walk from Darling Harbor, and 15-20 minutes to Circular Quay. The room was spacious, with a kitchen and upstairs loft with the bed. It's not a fancy hotel, but it did the trick for us and my wife and I were both very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartments”
Reviews.Author: Daveb33
Reviews.Content: These apartments, although in need of slight refurbishment, are clean and the staff are very helpful and friendly. We stayed on the 5th floor with a balcony view over Darling Harbour and have to say this was an added bonus. Try to get apartments on 5th floor or above as the traffic noise might be a bit intrusive,( my wife used ear plugs). The location of the apartments is spot on with only a short walk to the centre of the city or to the harbour. I have no hesitation in recommending these apartments and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 2 nights at this hotel/apartment complex. The location is excellent - very close to Darling Harbour, the city centre and public transport. The only down side is the noise of a night time! It is across the road from a pub/club and also one of the main traffic routes into the city. All night is a constant stream of traffic and noise/music from the club and pub. We were on the 5th floor and had to take sleeping tablets to get any rest. Would definately not recommend if a light sleeper. The room was fairly basic but clean! The hotel staff very friendly and helpful (except for the maintenance person who decided 7 a.m. sunday morning was a good time to start drilling in apartment next door).

Reviews.Title: “upstairs to bed”
Reviews.Author: Hartlepudlian
Reviews.Content: We stayed in these apartments in January 2006, yes they are a bit noisy but we were on 6th floor and so we did not enjoy too much of the traffic noise. Apartments are basic but there is everything you need for a short stay, and they are spotlessly clean. If we go to Sydney again we will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Darling Harbour. If you have a heavy case be aware there is a steep flight of stairs to reception area (no lift). Very friendly helpful staff. Plenty of restaurants closeby and the harbour ferrys just 2 mins walk away. We did not miss having a restaurant or bar on site because we found lots within easy walking distance. Noise from the traffic was an issue (dealt with by using earplugs) but this was more than made up for by the amenities in the apartment and its location. Being able to deal with our laundry mid way through our trip was very convenient. Initially we thought the apartment a bit small and basic however ended up happily spending a couple of nights in making use of the kitchen, laundry and TV. It made a welcome change from eating out every night. The apartment was clean and towels changed daily. In fact we had a reservation for another of the Metro chain of hotels booked for our return to Sydney but we would have prefered to return to The Metro on Sussex. For basic, no frills accommodation in fabulous location, we would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Take the ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: fionam_7
Reviews.Content: For proximity to Darling Harbour and the sights of Sydney, the Metro Apartments are ideal, the downside is the location directly next to a very busy road junction - day and night. My husband, two children and I found the Metro Apartments spotlessly clean, (particularly the bathroom!), with everything you would need for a short break in the city. The staff were very friendly but the apartment itself was looking a little jaded and could probably do with refurbishment. The traffic noise did detract from the trip unfortunately, particularly as Sydney drivers seem to like to use car horns in the early hours of the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities of home...in the heart of Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: KRS_blueflier
Reviews.Content: These serviced apartments are in the heart of the city. Each is a loft bedroom with downstairs living and kitchen areas -- and a balcony that overlooks Darling Harbour. It's not "glam" and doesn't have a restaurant or bar. But you have your own kitchen -- with stove, microwave, kettle and refrigerator. Great for us -- we'd have breakfast and coffee in before we left the hotel, and then we'd spend the day sightseeing or going to a conference. If you're like us, you don't want to eat out every single meal -- but don't always want to do all the cleaning up --- and if you want to be able to do laundry, but not the bedding and vacuuming and all that...then this is the place for you. I highly recommend the Metro Apartments on Sussex and will definitely be staying there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Metro Apartments On Darling Harbour
HotelInfo.Address: 132-136 Sussex St., Darling Harbour | Corner of King and Sussex Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
